name: node-go
description: Bindings for Go ABI and tooling to integrate Go code.

scripts.pretest: npm run lint && npm run inspect
scripts.posttest: (istanbul check-coverage --statements 90 --branches 90 --functions 100 --lines 90 && rm -rf coverage) || echo Look at 'coverage/lcov-report/index.html' to find out more

readme:
# node-go

Bindings for Go ABI and tooling to integrate Go code.

> This module was just created and has *no* exposed functionality so far. Do *not* download.

[![build status](https://secure.travis-ci.org/eljefedelrodeodeljefe/node-go.svg)](http://travis-ci.org/eljefedelrodeodeljefe/node-go)
[![dependency status](https://david-dm.org/eljefedelrodeodeljefe/node-go.svg)](https://david-dm.org/eljefedelrodeodeljefe/node-go)

## Installation

```
npm install --save node-go
```

## Research

Since the inception of 1.5 (tbc), `Go` offers `-buildmodes`, which effectively allow you to have unmangled symbols(tbc) in Go binaries and to call them via their an ABI. Read up un `-buildmodes` [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1nr-TQHw_er6GOQRsF6T43GGhFDelrAP0NqSS_00RgZQ/edit?pli=1).

Implementations for other languages can be found for [Python here](http://blog.ralch.com/tutorial/golang-sharing-libraries/) and [here](https://blog.filippo.io/building-python-modules-with-go-1-5/).

Rob Pike's talk [about the toolchain over at Hakka Labs](https://www.hakkalabs.co/articles/gopherfest-2015-rob-pike-move-c-go-toolchain)
